page.title: 11Elvering on the Severn.
page.content: Every spring many local people are among the 1000 licenced elver fisher- men who go at night to catch elvers. Using fine mesh nets they catch the young eels as they swim upstream close to the bank. Between 20 and 75 tonnes of elvers are caught each year. Catches in the last six years have declined. The haul in 1985 was 20 tonnes. 1 tonne contains about 3 million elvers. The elvers, having swum the Atlantic, are 3 years old and 8cm long when they are taken from the river. The fishermen take some of their catch home. Fried elvers and egg is a renowned local dish. The rest are sold to one of the four elvering stations. In 1985 they were paid Â£10_Â£15 per kilo. Many are then exported to America, Europe or even Japan where they are a delicacy.
